title: Are the Hunter Biden allegations an example of swiftboating? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Most definitely. Swiftboating refers to the practice of greatly inflating and distorting an event to smear a politician for political gain, named after the campaign of attack ads designed to make John Kerry look like a backstabbing Vietnam apologist during the 2004 Presidential campaign. Republicans have similarly spun a false narrative around Hunter Biden's Board position on a Ukranian gas company's Board designed to smear Joe Biden. Simply perusing the myriad fact checks around the Hunter Biden narrative reveals the depth of the deception (ex. Hunter Biden Archives - FactCheck.org). The fact checks (and detailed news reporting) make clear that the sequence of events around Joe Biden's role in ousting a corrupt prosecutor in Ukraine were part of ongoing US policy to address corruption in Ukraine, a critical ally in the front against Russian aggression. While Hunter Biden's board position does raise ethical concerns, they are in no way comparable to the much larger conflicts and ethical concern raised by Trump's family's continued business throughout areas of the world for Trump is making economic policy and imposing sanctions. The relatively modest $50k/month salary Hunter Biden received for his role as a corporate board member is a drop in the bucket compared to the hundreds of millions and even billions of dollars of business that Trump and his family have conducted all over the world that raised exactly the same kind of conflict of interest and ethics concerns, and unlike Hunter Biden's role, the Trump conflicts continue unabated daily. This fact alone reveals that the concerns about corruption in Ukraine I really just attacks on Biden. The fact that people now consider a hunter Biden's roll a something that's comprable to do much more problematic corruption conflicts of interest and ethical issues with Trump's family business dealings suggest that this particular smear has been somewhat successful. in the months after the impeachment hearings when it appeared that Joe Biden was not going to be Democratic candidate, we heard nothing from the Republicans about concerns of corruption revolving around Hunter Biden. The day after Biden's surge to first place in the South Carolina primary, Hunter Biden was once again a topic of great interest. This is a classic example of swiftboating.

please remember where the term swift-boating came from. John Kerry (D) is running for president. A MAJORITY of the military veterans who served directly with John Kerry, felt he was unqualified for the presidency and they stated this publicly! This is extraordinary! Think of our political climate, where could you find a majority of people going against the media, going against the democrat party machine, sticking their necks out and be open to such vile attacks as occurred? You can’t find that. Think of our American revolution, only about 1/3 of the people were eager to break away from the British. Here was an absolute majority of military veterans, who had directly served with John Kerry (D) who publicly stated he was unqualified. After this the media created this term swift-boating, to claim this was a smear against a candidate, it wasn’t it was men willing to risk everything to stop an unqualified candidate! As to investigating Hunter Biden, there is oral testimony from several sources about his crimes, there is written testimony about his crimes. The crimes should be investigated! There is no reason these crimes shouldn’t be investigated. Therefore let’s conduct a full investigation, determine what crimes were committed, and then determine if they are serious enough to warrant arrest, a trial and imprisonment. By the way, it may be that after a proper investigation it is found that Hunter Biden was essentially jay-walking. If that’s true exonerate him, publish it and end of story. However, my guess, with all the hot air from Joe Biden (D), that there are real crimes and Joe Biden (D) doesn’t want the truth about his own corruption coming out! Investigate the crimes and publish the facts with or without a trial, as appropriate!

To me there is absolutely no denying that Hunter made millions of dollars based on Joe’s Vice President position. The only question is whether anything criminal was done and if we really want to spend a couple of million dollars on an investigation. Then there is the question of whether Joe did anything criminal to help his son. I think President Obama needs to be subpoenaed to see if Joe had the authorization to do some of the things he did in Ukraine. And finally I would love to know if Ambassador Yovanovitch was working behind the scenes to help Hillary. In any of these situations I do not see any swiftboating techniques.

No, Swiftboating involves digging up a bunch of people from someone’s past to contradict the narrative they’ve created about themselves. On the one hand, it may provide illumination about aspects of someone’s past that they’d rather keep hidden, thereby shedding light on their character. On the other hand, most public people have people in their past who didn’t like them for one reason or another and it would be possible to accuse those people of sour grapes, dragging down someone they resent for going further than they did. The Swiftboating of Kerry did not take because the technique is infallible, but because the Swiftboaters’ characterizations of Kerry rang true enough with their perceptions of him from other things to stick. The big problem for Kerry is that he had highlighted his military experience and medals and done the “Reporting for Duty” shtick at the Democratic convention. The thing about Swiftboating is it only works if the people from one’s past seem to have a more credible take on what you’re about than what you have presented. Had Kerry presented himself as the guy who came back from Vietnam and threw away his medals because he had always stood against wars fought senselessly, and wanted to make sure the war in Iraq wasn’t just a pointless mess for a new generation, the Swiftboaters might have rallied those who hated Kerry anyway but they wouldn’t have caused others to look at whether Kerry was opportunistic or even hypocritical in invoking his military experience because the Kerry they presented wouldn’t have been that different from the Kerry he he himself presented. This is why Donald Trump gets away with so much: We all know he was a sleazy businessman, self-promoter and womanizer. Hell, that’s how he played himself on national television. It’s all fine and good to tell people he’s a horrible person, but everyone knows that and his supporters have made their peace with it. (I say this as someone who will probably vote for him this fall, fwiw). Now that we’ve seen what Swiftboating is, it’s clear that Hunter Biden isn’t about Swiftboating. For one thing, Joe Biden has always been the consummate Washington insider. That’s why Obama chose him as VP. For another, he’s long been joked about as the Senator from MBNA - the suggestion he hangs out with people who have money to pass around is not new. Further, Biden is not running as a reform candidate eager to drive the corruption from politics. That’s Bernie. Biden is running as the guy who will get things back to normal in Washington after the craziness of Trump. Hunter Biden is, more than anything else, a reminder of the corrupt side of business as usual in Washington, the business as usual that caused people to take a chance on Trump. Going after Hunter Biden is not about digging up some unknown’s from Biden’s path to make us wonder if he’s really who he says he is. It’s about noting that under business as usual in Washington, people close to power get wealthy without really bringing a lot to the table and that’s part of what Biden would bring back and he doesn’t seem to see anything wrong with that. And let’s be honest, if you can’t defend yourself on that one when you’re running against the father of Don Jr, Erik and Ivanka, you’ve got no business running.

Is Hunter Biden running for President? No. I never paid too much attention to the swiftboating allegations at the time. With the benefit of hindsight I would say that John Kerry…aka Swiftboat Veterans target…deserved it. Swiftboating was about cowardly or treasonous conduct with the enemy. There is some compelling evidence of this. Joe Biden is just an example of Barack Obama’s bagman. Perhaps that’s a crude analogy yet it fits with translation. Joe is no doubt a very cultured man compared to me. I am neculturny embodied. But Joe is actually a rather crude man. Had his own way for far too many years. I have the same problem.

I find it strange that in all the discussion over the Bidens and many others in high office that there is nothing about politicians exposing themselves to blackmail by a foreign government. That has the potential of effecting this whole country. Any person in high office, elected or otherwise should know that entangling themselves in any foreign business venture just doesn’t “pass the smell test”. Are they in it to serve the American people or not?

Yes. Absolutely. They didn’t give two shits about it till Joe Biden became a political threat to trump. Now the Republicans are all in. During the witness testimony, Republicans were warned by Ms. Hill to stop spreading debunked Russian conspiracy theories. If people still think there's some there-there; they weren’t paying attention. Paying attention means absorb credible testimony and ignore trump when he calls it or anything fake news.

If they are then the last 3.5 years have been nothing but that against Trump. and YES we do know Hunter was paid a MILLION $$$$ a year to work for a corrupt company because his daddy was VP. No dispute there, even from Hunter

I’d be happy to limit use of the term swiftboating to lying about someone’s military record. What Trump is saying about Hunter Biden is just an attempt at smearing, and a pretty lame obvious-bullshit one at that, since he clearly doesn’t give a damn about Hunter Biden and just wants to use him against Joe Biden. Sadly, it works because people are dumb.

Tactically, the GOP has for the last couple of decades attacked the strength of its opposition. John Kerry was targeted because of his war time accomplishments during the Vietnam conflict. Kerry’s strength, Bush’s weakness. Similarly, Trump assessed the regard in which Biden was held was a strength. Trump, on the other hand has been at least nine points under water. That was a weakness. Hence the need to undermine Biden. The Trump base was and is not of sufficient size to win him reelection. fivethirtyeight.com

While supporters of John Kerry thought the allegations brought by swiftboaters were a cheap shot, the allegations that Kerry had turned against his shipmates in his later retoric in opposition to the Vietnam war were true. What he was alleged to have done was proven as a matter of record. It so happened that Kerry's supporters didn't want it to be known during the campaign.

In a sense but Hunter Biden was used as a throw off point to upset the apple cart trumps idea he figured he do this to keep biden in line but it didn't work the republican party found that the Bidens had nothing to do with it so they backed off. trump has a habit of placing anyone involved in getting in his way to try to set them up or accuse them.
Yes. It was a ham-handed, obvious one, at that. Obvious enough to get POTUS impeached.

No. An example of swiftboating is Bernie beating Joe 3 to 1 with black voters under 45, and Joe’s friends in the media saying “Biden’s getting all the black votes in South Carolina and Bernie is only favored by white college students.” That’s called lying. The Swiftboat Veterans were lying. Hunter getting rich on his father’s legacy is a fact.

Dems accuse opponents of doing what THEY are actually doing! The biggest joke besides Biden withholding aid to Ukraine is when Crooked Hillary accused Trump of enriching himself in office! Pot calling the kettle black.
